```{r}
threshold1 = 0.8
threshold2 = 10
threshold3 = 0.3
n = 20 
```
### Standard: larger than threshold and max number of estimator is n.
```{r}
aaa<- function(x,threshold){
  a1<- x[order(-x)][1:n]*(x[order(-x)][1:n]>=threshold)
  a1[a1==0]<- NA
  res<- which(x %in% a1)[1:n]
  return(res)
}
result = t(apply(data1, 1, function(x) aaa(x,threshold1)))
value_matrix = as.numeric(matrix(0,dim(result)[1],dim(result)[2]))
for(x in 1:4151){
  for(y in 1:n){
    if(value_matrix[x,y] != NA){
      value_matrix[x,y] = 
    }
  }
}
```
